intro: Exostema angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of tubular flowers, typically in shades of red or purple, which bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
